attributes.action: STOP Mass Shia Genocide of Hazara Community in Pakistan
attributes.additional_details:
On Saturday 17 February, 84 Shi’a Hazaras, were killed when a bomb exploded in a vegetable market in Quetta, Pakistan.The bombing was claimed by the anti-Shi’a armed group Lashkar-e-Jhangvi (LeJ). LeJ also claimed responsibility for a series of bombings targeting Hazaras in Quetta on 10 January 2013 that claimed more than 90 lives

Petition Requirements:

A. The mass genocide of Shia Hazara should be stopped in Pakistan.

B. The UK government should request the ambassadors of Pakistan to the UK, to force Pakistan security officials to crack down on these target killings.

C. Amnesty Internationals' Asia-Pacific Director should be approached and requested; With the help of UN to take serious action against Pakistan Officials for their lapses. The UN should summon the Pakistan Government/Army to oust the LeJ from the affected areas.
